spec.description:
Hybrid-3-Tier Web App
Nutanix is now the ultimate power in the hyperconverged universe, I suggest we use it.

resources.user_data:
#cloud-config
# https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-user-account-cloud-init-user-data/
cloud_final_modules:
  - [users-groups,always]
users:
  - name: @@{teccdba.username}@@
    groups: [ wheel ]
    sudo: [ "ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL" ]
    shell: /bin/bash
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{teccdba.public_key}@@

#cloud-config
# https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-user-account-cloud-init-user-data/
cloud_final_modules:
  - [users-groups,always]
users:
  - name: @@{teccadmin.username}@@
    groups: [ wheel ]
    sudo: [ "ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL" ]
    shell: /bin/bash
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{teccadmin.public_key}@@

#cloud-config
# https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-user-account-cloud-init-user-data/
cloud_final_modules:
  - [users-groups,always]
users:
  - name: @@{teccdba.username}@@
    groups: [ wheel ]
    sudo: [ "ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL" ]
    shell: /bin/bash
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{teccdba.public_key}@@

#cloud-config
# https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-user-account-cloud-init-user-data/
cloud_final_modules:
  - [users-groups,always]
users:
  - name: @@{teccadmin.username}@@
    groups: [ wheel ]
    sudo: [ "ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL" ]
    shell: /bin/bash
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{teccadmin.public_key}@@

attrs.script:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ HAProxy installation..."
sudo yum install -y haproxy &&
  sudo systemctl enable haproxy || true # idempotent
haproxy -v

echo "__ HAProxy configuration..."
# http://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.8/configuration.html#4
port=80

echo "global
  log 127.0.0.1 local0
  log 127.0.0.1 local1 notice
  maxconn 4096
  quiet
  user haproxy
  group haproxy
defaults
  log global
  mode http
  retries 3
  timeout client 50s
  timeout connect 5s
  timeout server 50s
  option dontlognull
  option httplog
  option redispatch
  balance  roundrobin
# Set up application listeners here.
listen stats
  bind *:8080
  mode http
  log global
  stats enable
  stats hide-version
  stats refresh 30s
  stats show-node
  stats uri /stats
#listen admin
#  bind 127.0.0.1:22002
#  mode http
#  stats uri /
frontend http
  bind *:${port}
  maxconn 2000
  default_backend servers-http
backend servers-http" | sudo tee /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

sudo sed -i 's/server host-/#server host-/g' /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

hosts=$(echo "@@{WebServer.address}@@,@@{WebServerAWS.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")
for host in $hosts; do
  echo  "  server host-${host} ${host}:${port} weight 1 maxconn 100 check" | sudo tee -a /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
done

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y erase haproxy

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ Install httpd and php..."
sudo yum install -y httpd
sudo yum install -y php php-gd php-mbstring php-pdo php-mysqlnd

echo "<IfModule mod_dir.c>
        DirectoryIndex index.php index.html
</IfModule>" | sudo tee /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/dir.conf

echo "<?php
phpinfo();
?>" | sudo tee /var/www/html/index.php

sudo systemctl enable httpd

# temporarily disable SELinux to prevent httpd to MySQL authentication issues
# this is for testing only and should not be done in production environments
echo "__ Temporarily disable SELinux..."
sudo setenforce 0

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

sudo rm -rf /var/www/html/* || true
sudo yum erase -y httpd php || true

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "Generic uninstall script, goodbye!"

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ Install httpd and php..."
sudo yum install -y httpd
sudo yum install -y php php-gd php-mbstring php-pdo php-mysqlnd

echo "<IfModule mod_dir.c>
        DirectoryIndex index.php index.html
</IfModule>" | sudo tee /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/dir.conf

echo "<?php
phpinfo();
?>" | sudo tee /var/www/html/index.php

sudo systemctl enable httpd

# temporarily disable SELinux to prevent httpd to MySQL authentication issues
# this is for testing only and should not be done in production environments
echo "__ Temporarily disable SELinux..."
sudo setenforce 0

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

sudo rm -rf /var/www/html/* || true
sudo yum erase -y httpd php || true

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ HAProxy installation..."
sudo yum install -y haproxy &&
  sudo systemctl enable haproxy || true # idempotent
haproxy -v

echo "__ HAProxy configuration..."
# http://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.8/configuration.html#4
port=80

echo "global
  log 127.0.0.1 local0
  log 127.0.0.1 local1 notice
  maxconn 4096
  quiet
  user haproxy
  group haproxy
defaults
  log global
  mode http
  retries 3
  timeout client 50s
  timeout connect 5s
  timeout server 50s
  option dontlognull
  option httplog
  option redispatch
  balance  roundrobin
# Set up application listeners here.
listen stats
  bind *:8080
  mode http
  log global
  stats enable
  stats hide-version
  stats refresh 30s
  stats show-node
  stats uri /stats
#listen admin
#  bind 127.0.0.1:22002
#  mode http
#  stats uri /
frontend http
  bind *:${port}
  maxconn 2000
  default_backend servers-http
backend servers-http" | sudo tee /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

sudo sed -i 's/server host-/#server host-/g' /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

hosts=$(echo "@@{WebServer.address}@@,@@{WebServerAWS.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")
for host in $hosts; do
  echo  "  server host-${host} ${host}:${port} weight 1 maxconn 100 check" | sudo tee -a /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
done

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y erase haproxy

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ Install httpd and php..."
sudo yum install -y httpd

echo "<IfModule mod_dir.c>

# temporarily disable SELinux to prevent httpd to MySQL authentication issues
# this is for testing only and should not be done in production environments
echo "__ Temporarily disable SELinux..."
sudo setenforce 0

set -ex

sudo rm -rf /var/www/html/* || true
sudo yum erase -y httpd php || true

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "Generic uninstall script, goodbye!"

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ Install httpd and php..."
sudo yum install -y httpd
sudo yum install -y php php-gd php-mbstring php-pdo php-mysqlnd

echo "<IfModule mod_dir.c>
        DirectoryIndex index.php index.html
</IfModule>" | sudo tee /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/dir.conf

echo "<?php
phpinfo();
?>" | sudo tee /var/www/html/index.php

sudo systemctl enable httpd

# temporarily disable SELinux to prevent httpd to MySQL authentication issues
# this is for testing only and should not be done in production environments
echo "__ Temporarily disable SELinux..."
sudo setenforce 0

set -ex

sudo rm -rf /var/www/html/* || true
sudo yum erase -y httpd php || true

spec.name: Hybrid_Three_Tier_Web_App_Death_Star_II
